quest.name: The Kindness of Strangers
journal: Emeria of Hyrstmill is deeply troubled and could do with the aid of a kindly adventurer.
Emeria is the object of the unwanted attentions of a notorious thief named Ailbert. Meet him in the woods outside of Hyrstmill and convince him to leave the poor woman in peace.

Upon realizing that he has been spurned, Ailbert flies into a rage and lashes out. After subduing him, you discover a sealed letter addressed to the object of his affection. Deliver the letter to Emeria in Hyrstmill.
Moved by Ailbert's words, Emeria has resolved to return the goods stolen by the lovelorn thief on his behalf. Deliver Emeria's message to Miounne at the Carline Canopy.

Miounne reveals to you the truth about Ailbert and Emeria: they are brother and sister! Alas, Emeria has no memory of him, as she was too young to remember when he was forced to leave their home. Though Ailbert has yet to repent for his sins, perhaps Emeria's decision to return his gifts to their rightful owners will convince him to renounce his life of crime...

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: Pardon me, miladygood sir! Might you be the adventurer of whom Eadbert speaks so highly? If you could but spare a moment...

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: I-I've never thought myself a popular girl, and men rarely give me cause to believe otherwise... Yet lately I've been the recipient of several gifts.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: Sparkling jewels and fine silks over which a prouder maid than I would surely swoon─all from an anonymous admirer. Naturally, I was flattered...but I knew nothing of my mysterious benefactor.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: And so I endeavored to seek him out...only to discover that he is none other than Ailbert, an infamous rogue wanted for countless robberies in Gridania!

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: I realize now that all of his presents were taken from others...and that I have unwittingly won the affections of a dangerous criminal...

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: But that's not all... With his latest gift came a request.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: He insists that we meet in the woods outside of Hyrstmill, where he intends to present me with his most precious gift.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: I am at a loss. I beg of you, miladygood sir, will you not go in my stead?

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: I wish only to be left in peace, but I fear a man such as he may be driven to violence when made to hear such words. I pray no harm comes to you...

dialogue.name: AILBERT
dialogue.text: ...You expectin' someone, missymate? Eh? Ailbert!?

dialogue.name: AILBERT
dialogue.text: Well I'll be damned if I was expectin' you!

dialogue.name: AILBERT
dialogue.text: Where's Emeria!? Where is she, damn you!? What did you say to her!? All I wanted was to see her face!

dialogue.name: AILBERT
dialogue.text: I don't know what part you've played in this, but you'll pay for comin' between me an' mine!

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: All for naught... I give thanks that you're unharmed, at least.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: A letter? For me?

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"My dearest Emeria,

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"I pray this letter finds you well. I know my gifts were sudden and many, but I hope they were to your liking.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"Seeing you in the first summer of your womanhood, I could restrain myself no longer. My thoughts have been only of you these past many moons, of what gifts might bring you happiness.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"Yet to see you smile from afar is not nearly enough. I long to live together with you in Hyrstmill, and nothing would bring me greater joy.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"I would give you a grand garden, filled with the white chamomile you love so.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: (-Emeria-)"But such dreams can never come true. My crimes are known and will never be forgiven.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text:
(-Emeria-)"The most I can hope for is for you to know my heart. That would grant me a measure of peace. And so, if it does not cause you distress, I would write to you again.

Yours ever,

Ailbert“

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: Thank you for bringing me this letter, Forename. His most precious gift... I understand now.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: But...how did he know my favorite flower?

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: Is Ailbert...? No, no, it can't be...

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: A-Anyway, we must return the presents to their rightful owners! I know it will not erase this...Ailbert's sins, but perhaps the Twelve will view him more kindly.

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me this final request, but could you go to Gridania and speak with a woman named Miounne?

dialogue.name: EMERIA
dialogue.text: You should find her in the Carline Canopy. Tell her of all that transpired here today. She'll know what to do.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Hmmm? A message from Emeria of Hyrstmill, you say?

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: ...I see. Oh, Ailbert, you fool... I'll deal with the stolen goods, worry not.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Yes, I know of the boy─and his family. He once lived in this very town.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: One day, he stole a handful of chamomile seeds from an influential merchant in the Ebony Stalls. You see...this boy had a sister, and chamomile was her favorite flower.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Seeking only to make his sister happy, I doubt he grasped the gravity of his act. Regardless, his parents felt that he had brought terrible shame to the family. And so they disowned him.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Cast out of hearth and home, he grew desperate. And those who think only of survival think little of law. A common enough tale perhaps, but no less tragic for it.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: And now you know the truth: the sister Ailbert loved so dearly is Emeria.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Emeria was too young to remember when Ailbert left, so her parents decided to conceal his existence.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: However, word of the boy's banishment soon spread, and her parents were forced to move to Hyrstmill to maintain the fiction.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: By now, Emeria's surely heard rumors of her long-lost brother, though a gentle girl like her would never question her parents' honesty. And whatever faint memories she once may have had are long gone.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: But Ailbert has never forgotten Emeria. Despite the danger, I suspect he now keeps close to Gridania, refusing to leave his beloved sister a second time.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: ...I'll send Emeria some chamomile seeds by way of thanks for helping us to recover the stolen goods.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: If only it were as simple as returning them to their rightful owners... Sadly, Ailbert's crimes will not be so easily forgiven.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: But perhaps, by the time these seeds have sprouted and their flowers bloomed, he will have found a new path.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You hear a man cry out in rage!
